Class Method Details

. (void) md5cycle(x, k)

. (void) cmn(q, a, b, x, s, t)

. (void) gg(a, b, c, d, x, s, t)

. (void) hh(a, b, c, d, x, s, t)

. (void) ii(a, b, c, d, x, s, t)

. (void) md51(s)

. (void) md5blk(s)

there needs to be support for Unicode here,

  • unless we pretend that we can redefine the MD-5
  • algorithm for multi-byte characters (perhaps
  • by adding every four 16-bit characters and
  • shortening the sum to 32 bits). Otherwise
  • I suggest performing MD-5 as if every character
  • was two bytes--e.g., 0040 0025 = @%--but then
  • how will an ordinary MD-5 sum be matched?
  • There is no way to standardize text to something
  • like UTF-8 before transformation; speed cost is
  • utterly prohibitive. The JavaScript standard
  • itself needs to look at this: it should start
  • providing access to strings as preformed UTF-8
  • 8-bit unsigned value arrays.

. (void) rhex(n)

. (void) hex(x)

. (void) md5(s)

. (void) add32(a, b)

this function is much faster, so if possible we use it. Some IEs are the only ones I know of that need the idiotic second function, generated by an if clause.
